content.question: Two charged particles, <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, are fixed on a grid as shown in the figure. The particles have the same amount of charge but with opposite signs, as shown. Which of the following best represents the direction of the net electric field at point <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> due to the two particles?

choices.label: The figure presents an arrow pointing downwards and to the right.
The figure presents an arrow pointing downwards and to the left.
The figure presents an arrow pointing downwards.
The figure presents an arrow pointing horizontally to the right.

content.answer: The figure presents an arrow pointing downwards.
